ygData.subject: Re: Heritrix 1.4 fails to follow redirectoins off seed
ygData.msgSnippet: I should have mentioned that we re using seed-redirects-new-seed on hostqueuesfrontier.  The problem is that HostQueuesFrontier.receive checks curi.isSeed() &&

I should have mentioned that we're using seed-redirects-new-seed on 
hostqueuesfrontier.  The problem is that HostQueuesFrontier.receive 
checks curi.isSeed() && curi.getVia() != null before it adds the 
seed, but curi.setSeed() sets via = null, so the seed will never 
actually get added.


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "jirleech" <jirleech@w...> 
wrote:
> For our specific usage, domain scope tends to be to broad.  We 
want 
> to only follow a redirects to other sites, not links to other 
sites.
> 
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> > jirleech wrote:
> > 
> > > The previous verion of heritrix host scope would follow 
immediate
> > > redirects from the seed.  
> > 
> > 1.2?
> > 
> > > The current version no longer works in this
> > > fashion. We are using  the HostQueuesFontier.   
> > 
> > I tried 1.2.0, 1.4.0, and HEAD going against archive.org -- 
which 
> > directs you to www.archive.org -- and all seem to act the same 
> using 
> > HostScope and HQF (i.e. they don't follow redirected seeds).  
> There 
> > doesn't seem to have been a regression.
> > 
> > On the other hand, this seems like something we should just do.
> > 
> > I tried HEAD using bdbfrontier since HQF is deprecated, even in 
> 1.4.0, 
> > and this seems to do as you describe.
> > 
> > You don't want to use domainscope?
> > 
> > Yours,
> > St.Ack
> >
